lexUnit.name: hurt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a part of the body) suffer pain.

sentence.text: ` Do n't make a fuss , I did n't hurt a bit , " said Granny Morkie , cheerfully , as she examined his leg .
His arm was hurting beneath its bandage .
At lunchtime Dot 's ears began hurting inside her head as though they were filling with hot fire .
If things were n't going badly enough , her feet hurt inside new shoes , and then he showed up .
My doctor tells me that leg of his must still be hurting like the devil .
I was able to breathe only with the utmost difficulty , and my arm hurt like hell .
My broken finger hurt like hell .
He had learned to bear their ridicule without so much as a tear , but the names Sweetheart called him when she was really angry could make his body hurt like a bad pain on the inside .
Her head hurt with trying to make sense of it .
Coughing was a bleak thought , the way my chest hurt .
I stopped , puffed -- you puff as much going down steep hills as you do going up , and your thighs hurt .
I knew most of me hurt , but was not sure which bits might cause lasting problems .
